newsitem.title: USA: KENSEY SAY FDA GRANTS EXPANDED SEAL USE.
newsitem.headline: KENSEY SAY FDA GRANTS EXPANDED SEAL USE.

text.p: Kensey Nash Corp said Monday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved an expanded range of device users for its Angio-Seal puncture closure device.
The company said the Angio-Seal device may now be used by physicians, nurses, fellows, residents and other healthcare personnel.

The company's said the Angio-Seal device, its major product, seals arterial punctures created during common cardiac catheterization procedures such as diagnostic angiography, balloon angioplasty and placement of stents.
It said the Angio-Seal addresses a $1 billion market for sealing punctures created during the approximate six to seven million cardiac catheterizations performed worldwide each year.
Kensey Nash said it believes the Angio-Seal device is the first and only puncture closure device to have received such expanded user approval.
